snippet: The polar vortex took the jet stream for a turn in the South on Monday and Tuesday, bringing freezing temperatures as far south as Florida.
abstract: Polar vortex, while continuing to leave a lethal chill over the Midwest, takes jet stream for a turn in the South, bringing freezing temperatures as far south as Florida and arctic misery to a part of the country that is unaccustomed to it.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Atlanta, and Campbell Robertson from New Orleans. Reporting was contributed by Matthew L. Wald from Washington, Steven Yaccino from Chicago, Jess Bidgood from Boston, Bruce Dobie from Nashville, John Peragine from Asheville, N.C., and Ken Maguire in Falls Church, Va.

lead_paragraph: The polar vortex took the jet stream for a turn in the South on Monday and Tuesday, bringing freezing temperatures as far south as Florida.

headline.main: Arctic Blast Proves Unwelcome Novelty, Especially Across South
headline.print_headline: Arctic Blast Proves Unwelcome Novelty, Especially Across South
